title: Rotational inertia - claim about rotational axis

content.question: Which of the following claims about the rotational inertia of a rigid object is true?

choices.label: Moving the rotational axis from the center of mass to another axis parallel to the original axis will always increase the rotational inertia of the object about the axis.

Moving the rotational axis from the center of mass to another axis parallel to the original axis will only increase the rotational inertia of the object about the axis if the mass is distributed symmetrically about the center of mass.
Moving the rotational axis from the center of mass to another axis parallel to the original axis will always decrease the rotational inertia of the object about the axis.

Moving the rotational axis from the center of mass to another axis parallel to the original axis will only decrease the rotational inertia of the object about the axis if the mass is distributed symmetrically about the center of mass.

content.answer: Moving the rotational axis from the center of mass to another axis parallel to the original axis will always increase the rotational inertia of the object about the axis.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
